unit_learning_outcomes.description: Gain a greater understanding of the physiology and pharmacology of brain function.
Clearly and efficiently communicate the reasoning, methodological design, and outcome of a research paper.
Apply knowledge of brain function to understanding the underpinnings of mental illness, neurodevelopmental disorders and neurodegenerative diseases.
Critically analyse journal articles on mental illness, neurodevelopmental disorders and neurodegenerative diseases based on their methodological design, reasoning and data.

enrolment_rules.description: PSYH490 or PSHY4490 or PSYH495 or PSYH4495 or PSYH4492

assessments.description: Students are expected to participate in class discussions particularly during oral presentations to foster an understanding and critical evaluation of research papers that are read prior to class.
Students are required to submit an eight page essay (excluding references) critically evaluating research topics on an advanced physiological psychology issue.
Students are to individually select a relevant neuroscience article and present their arguments in a 30 minute PowerPoint presentation

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: PSYH4461 - Advanced Topics in Physiological Psychology

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: The aims of this seminar are to introduce and develop students' understanding and awareness of current topics in contemporary neuroscience. Students will develop the ability to critically evaluate, present and discuss research papers. This seminar series will cover a wide range of topics in the field of neuroscience such as neural stem cell research, transgenic research, neural basis of emotions, anxiety disorders, depression and drug addiction. Essay and presentation topics will be allocated or guided by the students' own interest in neuroscience.
data.search_title: PSYH4461 - Advanced Topics in Physiological Psychology
